evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred during the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD flight on 10-25, as evidenced in historical data segment hist_t1_early.

defeaters: Evidence showing explicit communication or coordination issues among the crew during the flight would change my mind.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided historical data indicates any communication or coordination breakdown among the crew during the flight; all statements focus on the aircraft undershoot and damage without mention of crew interaction issues.

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure occurred in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25 during hist_t1_early.

defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control failure in the aircraft during hist_t1_early period.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates a mechanical or control failure occurred; all evidence points to an undershoot and runway light strike without reported mechanical issues (H1, H3, H4, S1, S2, S3).

node.statement: Availability of data and evidence regarding environmental or marking deficiencies in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: If no physical inspection or reports had been conducted or documented
If evidence showed no damage or no records of such damage existed

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.

Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, H2, S2) documents the discovery of a missing frangible light and tyre marks consistent with aircraft contact, plus formal reporting of the damage, confirming availability of data and evidence on environmental/marking deficiencies.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early dataset.

defeaters: If evidence were found in the dataset Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early explicitly documenting the procedural deviation in pushback execution.
outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided evidence items (H1-H4, S1-S3) mention or document a procedural deviation in pushback execution, nor do they indicate that such information is available in the specified dataset.

node.statement: Assessment of how well the identified environmental or marking deficiencies fit the key features observed in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

assumptions: The missing frangible light was caused by the aircraft undershoot
Tyre marks and fence damage relate to the same event
defeaters: If evidence showed the aircraft did not contact or damage any runway lights or markings
If environmental conditions were not as described or did not contribute to the undershoot

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent , the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms the presence of environmental/marking deficiencies (missing frangible light) exactly at the runway undershoot area where the aircraft touched down short (S1, H4). The observed tyre marks and damage fit the key features of the event.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Some uncertainty remains due to lack of detailed flight crew report and exact timing of damage discovery

node.statement: Evaluation of the resistance of the environmental or marking deficiency claim to potential defeaters or counter-evidence in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early.

defeaters: If the flight crew had reported striking the light or if evidence showed the light was intact before the incident, the claim's resistance would be weaker.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms the environmental/marking deficiency (missing frangible light) and its damage by the aircraft. The flight crew's unawareness of striking the light (H3, H4, S3) limits counter-evidence from crew reports, supporting resistance to defeaters.
outcome.uncertainty_source: The absence of detailed crew reports and lack of further investigation details create some ambiguity about the full context of the deficiency and its impact.

node.statement: The mechanical/control failure matches the key features observed in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25 at hist_t1_early.

defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control failure in the aircraft during the event
Pilot or maintenance reports indicating mechanical issues
Physical inspection findings of aircraft mechanical systems post-event
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates any mechanical or control failure; all evidence points to environmental factors and pilot response without mechanical issues (H4, S1, S3).

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident on 10-25, including timing, crew interactions, and operational context in hist_t1_early.

defeaters: Evidence showing explicit communication or coordination breakdown among crew in the incident
Details linking crew interactions and timing to communication failures
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items discusses communication or coordination breakdown among crew or aligns such breakdown with timing, crew interactions, or operational context in hist_t1_early for the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD incident.

node.statement: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew resists defeaters based on the available evidence from the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD 10-25 incident in hist_t1_early, with no contradictory data undermining this root cause.

defeaters: Evidence showing crew communication or coordination was effective or that the incident was caused by other factors such as weather or pilot error without communication issues.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items addresses communication or coordination breakdown among crew or contradicts it; the evidence focuses on the aircraft undershoot and damage without mentioning crew communication.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features observed in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early scope, reflecting typical patterns and characteristics.

defeaters: Evidence showing procedural deviation in pushback execution and its characteristics matching the key features in the specified scope.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items describes or analyzes the procedural deviation in pushback execution or its alignment with key features in the specified scope; all evidence relates to landing undershoot and damage, not pushback.

node.statement: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t1_early scope is robust and resistant to common defeaters or alternative explanations.

assumptions: The damage and marks found are solely attributable to the aircraft undershoot
The lack of crew reporting implies unawareness rather than concealment
No other sources of damage or procedural deviation were present
defeaters: If additional direct evidence from the flight crew or cockpit data recorder confirming procedural deviation were available
If further detailed investigation reports clarifying the exact sequence and cause of the undershoot were provided
If alternative explanations for the damage and marks (e.g., ground vehicle or environmental factors) were ruled out more conclusively

quotes.exact_quote: Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.
Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing

I was totally unaware that I struck [anything]. Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows damage consistent with aircraft undershoot and lack of crew awareness or reporting (H1, H3, H4, S2, S3), indicating procedural deviation identification relies on indirect inference rather than direct crew confirmation, reducing robustness against alternative explanations.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and accessible during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs and physical presence records during the operation timeframe

children_spec.statement: Communication devices were operational and available to all crew members
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify maintenance and functionality reports of communication equipment during the event

children_spec.statement: Crew members were not engaged in conflicting tasks that prevented communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Review task assignments and workload distribution logs to identify potential conflicts

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time match known deficiency patterns
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare recorded environmental data (weather, visibility, lighting) with conditions known to cause deficiencies

children_spec.statement: Markings present at the site are inconsistent with regulatory standards
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect and compare site markings against applicable regulatory standards and guidelines

children_spec.statement: There is documented evidence of environmental or marking deficiencies affecting operations
children_spec.test_procedure: Review incident reports, maintenance logs, or witness statements indicating deficiencies

node.statement: There is no evidence contradicting the mechanical/control failure as the cause in Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25 during hist_t1_early.

assumptions: No mechanical/control failure was reported or detected since none is mentioned in evidence
defeaters: If evidence showed mechanical or control system anomalies or failures during the flight
If flight crew reported control issues
If investigation found mechanical faults

Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’

outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence contradicts mechanical/control failure as cause; flight crew unaware of striking obstacles (H3, H4, S3), weather and approach conditions suggest external factors (S1), and damage consistent with undershoot (H1).
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of detailed mechanical system data and absence of crew reports on control issues

node.statement: There is documented evidence of environmental or marking deficiencies affecting operations

defeaters: If evidence showed the light was missing prior to the incident or unrelated to operations
If the damage was caused by ground vehicles rather than aircraft

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence from H1 and S2 documents environmental/marking deficiencies (missing/damaged frangible light) caused by the aircraft undershoot, confirming documented environmental or marking deficiencies affecting operations.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No ambiguity; evidence clearly documents the deficiency and its operational impact.

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and physical condition to verify presence and integrity of mechanical control components

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were accessible and not obstructed during operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine cockpit and control linkage areas for any obstructions or access issues during the incident timeframe

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were properly connected and functional at the time of the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct functional tests and review inspection logs to confirm connectivity and operational status of mechanical controls
